data.title: Historical Sage Library
data.meta_description: Our libraries are cultural hubs that transform our community by providing vital opportunities connecting people, ideas, and information.

Library Branch: Sage Branch Library

Room: Sage Branch Community Room

Age Group: Babies & Toddlers, Children, Tweens, Teens

Program Type: Other

Registration Required

Event Details:

Meet Up, Eat Up, and READ Up at your library! Kids and teens ages 0-18 can enjoy a free lunch on the lawn along with a free book!

Disclaimer(s)

Registration is required. Please register in person, by phone, or online.

Stories & Songs in the Park

Sage Branch Library

Registration

This event is in the "Family" group.

This event is in the "Babies & Toddlers" group.

This event is in the "Children" group.

Library Branch: Sage Branch Library

Room: Sage Lawn (Pershing Park)

Age Group: Family, Babies & Toddlers, Children

Program Type: Music, Storytime

Registration Required

Seats Remaining: 79

Event Details:

Join us for Stories and Songs in the Park at Sage Library! Stop by Pershing Park (next to Sage Library) for some story time fun weather permitting. Geared toward children ages 0-6 with adult and family! Registration is required.

Disclaimer(s)

This program is designed for children and accompanying adults. Please plan to attend and be engaged with your child for this program. Drop offs will not be permitted.

Registration is required. Please register in person, by phone, or online.

This event is in the "Teens" group.

Buttercream Cookie Decorating w/ Simple Roots

Sage Branch Library

Registration

This event is in the "Teens" group.

Library Branch: Sage Branch Library

Room: Sage Branch Community Room

Age Group: Teens

Program Type: Other

Registration Required

Seats Remaining: 0

Event Details:

Join Jaime from Simple Roots as we learn techniques for decorating cookies!

Disclaimer(s)

Participant must be in grades sixth through twelfth (6-12) to register for this program

Preschool Storytime - Sage

Sage Branch Library

Registration

This event is in the "Babies & Toddlers" group.

This event is in the "Children" group.

Library Branch: Sage Branch Library

Room: Sage Branch Community Room

Age Group: Babies & Toddlers, Children

Program Type: Storytime

Registration Required

Seats Remaining: 0

Preschool Storytime

Join us with your preschooler for stories, rhymes, music, movement, and early literacy fun!

Best for ages 2-5 with a participating caregiver.

Event Details:

Registration for all BCLS summer storytimes begins on May 17, 2024.

Disclaimer(s)

The library makes every effort to ensure our programs can be enjoyed by all. If you have any concerns about accessibility or need to request specific accommodations, please contact the library.

This program is designed for children and accompanying adults. Please plan to attend and be engaged with your child for this program. Drop offs will not be permitted.

Registration is required. Please register in person, by phone, or online.

Baby Storytime

Nurture a love of books in your baby! Enjoy songs, rhymes, and stories, followed by a chance for play!

Best for children under the age of 2 with a participating caregiver.

Event Details:

Registration for all BCLS summer storytimes begins on May 17, 2024.

Disclaimer(s)

The library makes every effort to ensure our programs can be enjoyed by all. If you have any concerns about accessibility or need to request specific accommodations, please contact the library.

Registration

This event is in the "Adults" group.

Library Branch: Sage Branch Library

Room: Sage Lawn (Pershing Park)

Age Group: Adults

Program Type: Other

Registration Required

Seats Remaining: 17

Event Details:

Tai Chi for Arthritis and Falls Prevention helps people with or without arthritis to improve balance, both mentally and physically, which helps significantly reduce the rate of falls experienced by older adults.

Disclaimer(s)

The library makes every effort to ensure our programs can be enjoyed by all. If you have any concerns about accessibility or need to request specific accommodations, please contact the library.
